document.masterDocTitle: The cumacean genus Iphinoe (Crustacea: Peracarida) from Italian waters and I. daphne n. sp. from the northwestern Adriatic Sea, Mediterranean

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The cumacean genus Iphinoe (Crustacea: Peracarida) from Italian waters and I. daphne n. sp. from the northwestern Adriatic Sea, Mediterranean

subSubSection.paragraph:
In order to facilitate identification (mainly of adult specimens), a dichotomous key of the Atlanto-Mediterranean
Iphinoe
species is provided here. When the sex is not stated, the feature described applies to females and males. Finally, the diagnostic characters are written in bold.

heading.emphasis:
IPHINOE
species key from atlanto-mediterranean waters

paragraph.keyLead:
3. CL/CD: 2.4; dorsal carina armed,
basis length of pereopod 1 subequal to the other joints together, seta formula 11; 5+ 11
in females....................................................................
I. rhodaniensis Ledoyer, 1965

- CL/CD: 1.5; dorsal carina unarmed in adult males; pseudorostrum slightly upturned, with some distal hairs...............................................................................................
I. crassipes Hansen, 1895

5. Pseudorostrum bifid and long ....................................................
I. acutirostris Ledoyer, 1965

7. Pereopod 1, basis subequal to the other joints together , seta formula 10–12; 4–5+12 ..........
I. douniae Ledoyer, 1965
- Pereopod 1 basis length different from rest of pereopod 1 ................................................... 8
8. Pereopod 1 basis longer than the other joints together........................................................ 9

- Pereopod 1 basis shorter than the other joints together, seta formula 12; 4+12 ..................
I. armata Ledoyer, 1965
10. Pereopod 1 basis shorter than the other joints together...................................................... 11

- Pereopod 1 basis longer than the other joints ..............................................
I. inermis Sars, 1878

11. Uropod seta formula 8; 4+8........................................
I. canariensis Corbera, Brito and Nunez, 2002

12. Pseudorostrum bifid , long, carina armed............................................
I. acutirostris Ledoyer, 1965

13. Antenna 2 not reaching the end of the pleon ..............................................
I. inermis Sars, 1878

15. P2 carpus with 3 plumose setae, sternal process with 6 digits ..............................
I. douniae Ledoyer, 1965

16. P2 carpus with 2 plumose setae, sternal process with 6/8 digits .............................
I. armata Ledoyer, 1965

- P2 carpus with 1 plumose seta, sternal process bifid .............................................
I. daphne
n. sp.

17. Uropod peduncle with serrulate setae distally on inner margin, CL/CD=2, sternal process with 6–8 digits ...........................................................................................
I. trispinosa ( Goodsir, 1843 )
- Uropod peduncle without serrulate setae distally on the inner margin.......................................... 18

18. Sternal process with 4 cup-like digits , CL/CD=1.96....................................
I. maculata Ledoyer 1965

- Sternal process with 8 teeth, CL/CD=2.3.............................
I. canariensis Corbera, Brito and Nunez, 2002

- Pleonite 6 with 6 perianal setae , 1 aesthetasc on antennal .....................................
I. tenella Sars, 1878

- Antenna 1 with 2 aesthetascs , CL/CD=2.3..............................................
I. serrata Normann, 1867
